newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch call money rates rise ahead of the weekend.
newsitem.headline: Dutch call money rates rise ahead of the weekend.

text.p: Dutch call money rates clambered up on Friday ahead of the weekend and dealers said an uneven distribution of liquidity among some participants could have contributed to pushing the rate up.
Call money, trading as low as 2.25 percent bid earlier this week and advancing to 2.62 on Thursday, rose to around 2.75 percent bid on Friday.
But dealers said there were only a few deals settled at that price, adding overall trade was slim.
Other money market rates were unchanged with three-year deposits bid at 2.78 percent.
Dealers foresee little movement in the money market in the near-term. "The yield curve is very flat," said one dealer, adding participants were likely to stay sidelined.
The guilder was virtually unchanged at 112.1925 per 100 marks from 112.19 on Thursday.
